Reviews.Title: “We were thrilled!”
Reviews.Author: Paulette G
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton on East Market St. When we had a problem with the sleep system bed, the wonderful staff went above and beyond what we expected. They made our stay in Indy a great experience... we're still talking about it! Although the hotel was extremely busy, the hotel staff went out of their way to make us feel like we were their only guests. It's hard to find service and sincere concern like we experienced over the St. Patrick's Day weekend. Superb!

Reviews.Title: “nice location downtown”
Reviews.Author: salinafred
Reviews.Content: I had a queen room suite and it was huuuge lots of room 2 tvs internet Staff was really nice Hotel was very nice and updated Had a nice breakfast buffett Had about everything you would want. Top floor pool had an atrium very nice. Could walk to lots of stuff downtown etc restaurants, bars, mall and other shopping

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mvparker
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. It is clean and sophisticated. The rooms are spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Dra23
Reviews.Content: I had a group of approximately 45 people stay here for the week of the Super Bowl. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The staff was incredible, very attentive, and knowledgeable about the area, incredibly helpful and always pleasant to deal with. The hotel itself was clean, comfortable and very welcoming. We did a lot of walking to/from the events and the lobby was almost like coming home. The location was perfect amazing restaurants within walking distance. I recommend this hotel to anyone going to Indy for business or pleasure. I know when I go back I will be staying with them!

Reviews.Title: “Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: JulieLove13
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, historic property in the heart of Indianapolis. The beds were extremely comfortable, the hotel staff was friendly and professional, and the property was impeccably clean. The only negatives were our lack of any type of a view and the room was rather small. Neither of which had any impact on our weekend stay. The location was perfect. It was within walking distance to everything we wanted; museums, shopping, restaurants and clubs. We will definitely stay there on our next visit to Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, convenient, and cool in north end of downtown”
Reviews.Author: UticaEdge
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel because close to my business appointment following day but would choose it again for a weekend trip to this interesting city. Large rooms in converted bank building--large lobby and friendly staff-- my window looked out on Monument Square and easy walk to Farmers Market food booths for lunch and the eclectic shops on Mass. Ave. On cultural trail with kinetic art and murals

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Beds, Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: misand
Reviews.Content: We had a corner room with 2 beds. This gave us windows on 2 walls which was really nice. We loved the select comfort beds. We were in town for a cheer competition, so the walk to the convention center wasn't that bad, but it took a while to get there. We cut through the mall since it was so cold out. The pool at the hotel was in the basement. We enjoyed that for a little while! There is a CVS down the street in case you forget anything!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: takemeaway1127
Reviews.Content: While the front desk seem pleasant, the first room I was assigned was 2 doubles (1110 I think) and I had requested a King. Nice large corner room with views, but I was moved to a King 1103. No View-into the window of the building next door and no city view Unfortunately this room was small with an oversized bathroom...and unsettling residue on the headboard(yucko) I was moved the next night again to 710 with 2 doubles as no other King was open. No back (had let the person know when moved me) . The restaurant breakfast team was friendly, dinner seemed overworked and not too attentive. Did not have automatic entrance doors and the Valet was never there to assist when I had my arms full. Good Location near the center statue. I arrived after the SBowl to crazy road closings while cleaning up the city. Interestingly, probably the first Hilton that at check out that I was NOT asked if I enjoyed my stay...maybe they knew it was less than adequate...

Reviews.Title: “Great place, location, and service!”
Reviews.Author: joelinda
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this place. Maybe it was because they noticed my Hilton status and upgraded me to a very nice suite. No, that was nice but it was the very helpful service I received from the door man and front desk. I needed to meet people downtown and didn't have a clue where I was going or where to park. The directions, patience, and help they gave me were great! Oh, the room was great, the wifi was strong, and the water was HOT! I'll be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the historic building!”
Reviews.Author: ImTravlinLight
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a fantastic location in downtown Indy. You can truly get anywhere in the city. I stayed here as the hotel was hosting the convention that I was attending. The hotel was so great to everyone in the convention! I don't recall what floor I stayed on, but I was quite amazed at the height of the ceiling in our room. Historic buildings always have the quirkiest surprises. As one reviewer mentioned, there is a stairwell that you can not get back into the floors on. However, it is very clearly marked, so it is definitely the inattentiveness of the reviewer for getting "stuck" in there. I'm from a large city with high-rises, so most large buildings have stairwells that you can not re-enter, one just has to be aware & read the signs.

Reviews.Title: “I liked this more than the regular Hilton three blocks away”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoOrange
Reviews.Content: I really liked this property. I stayed at the regular Hilton a few times prior, and I actually liked this property better. Obviously it's not a full service hotel like the Hilton, but the staff is exceptionally helpful and everything feels more streamlined here. Great location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel & staff in downtown Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: travelbarbi
Reviews.Content: Our out of town guests and members of the bridal party stayed in the Hilton Garden Inn recently for our daughter's wedding at a nearby venue. I can't say enough about how pleasant our stay was here. Celia Belden, the lady who helped us make our arrangements for rooms & a bridal breakfast, was extremely helpful and accommodating. Things went very smoothly and all the staff we encountered was friendly. The rooms were clean, spacious, and comfortable. We never heard a guest from an adjoining room or even footsteps or doors closing in the hall. The breakfast food was very good. Loved this place listed on the national historical registry. It was formally a bank and was the second to the last bank robbed by Dillinger! Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: raynak
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel feet from monument circle. Perfect location for downtown dining, shopping or colts game. Personnel were friendly and helpful, room was clean. Stairwell has a fire-code issue-once you get in the stairwell, you can't get out unless someone lets you out! Even one of the staff remarked that it was the only stairwell that ran all the way from the top floor to the bottom and that it probably was a bad deal that the doors had no handles on the inside. I liked the hotel, but they need to get that fixed! Parking was $14 a night, and we were able to leave our car there during the game for an extra $6. Great deal!

Reviews.Title: “B- / C+”
Reviews.Author: RoadTrippin22
Reviews.Content: Using a report card grading system I would have to give this hotel a B- or a C+. Upon check in we found a "personality challenged" desk clerk. After checking in we head to our room only to find that the door entry cards they had given us did not work. After trying every way possible to get them to open the door we finally gave up and called the front desk to report the problem. The "personailty challenged" desk clerk and the maintenance man both came to our floor and worked together to fix the door entry problem. No genuine apology was expressed from either of them for our inconvenience. We got over our frustration about the door after we saw the room. They are beautifull decorated and spacious! Once I saw the HUGE jacuzzi tub I knew that I was going to want to take a long, relaxing soak later that night. Well.. that didn't work out either. There was little to no hot water to even begin to fill the tub. After trying to get even 1-2 inches of hot to warm water into the tub I gave up. So.. there was no long, relaxing soak for me that night. We had a great nights sleep. The bed (and sleeper sofa) are really comfortable. Something a little "un-nerving" happened the morning we were checking out. The maid came into our room at 8:45am by just by opening the door with her entry card/door key. The deadbolt on the door lock was not locked as it should have been (our bad) only the door knob lock was locked ..but why would the maid be coming by so early in the morning? And why wouldn't she have knocked? I went a couple of steps down the hall to see what she wanted and all she said was "sorry". I think that with all of the other hotels in the same area another might be a little more attentive to their guest.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotel in Downtown Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: LizzChicago
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times and have hosted 2 breakfast meetings in the Ovid Butler Room. The staff is friendly and easy to work with, especially Celia for meeting planning. It's a great location for visiting downtown Indianapolis clients. My only complaint is that is takes forever to get your car when you valet. It's an issue for several downtown hotels in Indianapolis so always call 10-15 minutes ahead to have your car brought up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: kio607
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention and it was a great hotel as most Hilton garden Inn's are. Walking distance to the Indianapolis Convention Center and plenty of places to eat. Rooms very clean. Staff was great and helpful. Also Valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Excellent property.”
Reviews.Author: Bulldozers
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for one night and felt this was an excellent experience. Free wifi, easy access to late night snack, located near multiple family friendly restaurants. Our room was clean and neat with some added conveniences. Reason I didn't give 5 stars r picky things like the TV menus steering my five year olds to adult movies etc. Fine if not with family but with family maybe there needs to be a little less freedom. Also the breakfast buffet had some nice options but maybe should have had someone making over easy eggs cracked from a fresh egg etc vs the good old scrambled eggs dumped out of the basic rubber bag. The front desk staff was friendly but needed a bit of work on truly warm demeanors. Valets were all polite and friendly. Handy ice and vending on our floor.

Reviews.Title: “Love the old buildings”
Reviews.Author: LAJFJ2
Reviews.Content: Looked for a Hilton property to stay in because of our Hilton Points. Found this old building that has been renovated. Beautiful lobby with white pillars. Love the art deco buildings. The rooms have tall ceilings so the room feels bigger than a modern room. The beds were comfortable, the room was clean, and the service was top. The location is in the city center. Just one block fron the Indy Circle. Lots of restaurants, shopping mall nearby, and parking garage near hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Friendly Staff! Hard Beds!”
Reviews.Author: stretchuga100
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a great hotel walking distance to everything in Downtown. The staff was very attentative and friendly in assisting us. My only complain is the beds are hard and lumpy and the the hot water when taking a shower was not consistent. We were told the hotel was older and used steam for the plumbing so it caused the noises we heard and reason for inconsistent water temperature. If you do not mind the latter, this a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic HGI”
Reviews.Author: Nitroxprt
Reviews.Content: A gem in downtown Indianapolis What a great find!!! This is a renovated historic building from 1916 (Wikepdia) in the heart of downtown Indy. It was once a bank (Fletcher Savings and Trust) and still shows a lot of the ambience from that by gone era. Everything is here and within walking distance, including Lucas Oil Stadium. I had a spacious room on the 14th floor that offered a great view of the downtown skyline. As with all HGI’s the standards are above average with a very personal and attentive staff. To me this experience was totally positive,and I would have no hesitation staying at this property again, or recommending it to anyone. A+++++

Reviews.Title: “Always nice”
Reviews.Author: jwrichte
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for the price. Nothing spectacular as far as views go, but great service and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: INDrob83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend event. Even though we live in Indy, wanted to make a fun weekend of everything! I was very impressed by this hotel. The lobby is amazing. It's very elegant and unique, due to the fact the building is an historic landmark. The rooms were quite nice and modern. The beds can be adjusted, though they are very confusing to use, and I didn't notice any difference in settings, but they were quite comfortable all the same. I requested a late checkout, and was offered 2pm! This was amazing to me, as 1pm is typically the cut off. I typically stay in Marriott properties, but this Hilton will be high on my list if I plan to stay in downtown Indianapolis again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: Thomas S
Reviews.Content: We went to Indy for a getaway weekend and a concert. The hotel was in the center of downtown and very short walking distance from shopping, restaurants, night clubs and sporting venues. The hotel is located steps away from the historic Monument Circle, and close to the river walk and the new 9/11 exhibit. Hotel staff were very nice, and their restuarant recommendation was spot on. Hotel rooms were average size and very clean but the lobby has the look of an older hotel. Hotel bar is nothing special. Valet parking is not necessary as there is a parking deck literally across the street for $9 per day. Perfect location if you are headed to downtown Indy !

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: deerat97
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference in July. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. I usually stay at Marriott but all Marriott properties were sold out and they (Marriott) doubled their prices for this busy weekend in Indianapolis. I called this property and got a very large double room for a great price. The location was wonderful and I will defiantly stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: pacersguy31
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 4 nights for the Indy 500 Memorial Day weekend 2011 for the Race. Typically we have stayed at the Sheraton downtown, however, that was booked, so we booked this hotel. Great choice - everything was great - the rooms were great - quiet and very clean/comfortable. The bathrooms were really clean and everything looked like it had been remodeled recently. We hit the bar a few times in the lobby - not really alot of selection there, but that is fine. We hit it more for drinks. Not sure if they have a menu or aps. Really, it doesn't matter b/c you are a few steps from every restaurant in downtown Indy once you walk outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff. Nice enough hotel”
Reviews.Author: MisplacedOhioan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night last week-end when we couldn't get a room at the Residence Inn on the Canal (our "regular" downtown hotel). The staff was very helpful (apologized and made up for a slight mix-up with reservations). The bed in one of the rooms appeared to be lumpy (we were a bit worried about it), but turned out to be very comfy. It's an older hotel, and there were odors, but the room was clean and the bathroom was enormous. Microwave and mini fridge were a plus, and the TV was new and full-featured (even had HDMI port). The hotel was full to capacity, but the rooms were quiet. It's right off Monument Circle, and convenient to everything downtown. Prices make it a really good deal for a downtown hotel

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again unless I have to.”
Reviews.Author: motogrrl2003
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights on business. Rock hard bed, my room smelled of cigarettes, the ac couldn't keep up, the room was humid and dank, and I ate something in the restaurant that had me sick for three days. Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “Short unplanned stay - no worries!”
Reviews.Author: rumours78
Reviews.Content: I was snowed in at my office and needed a place to stay downtown overnight. We couldn't get on the interstate that night, so this was very short notice. I had no problems booking a room (it probably helped that it was a random Tuesday in February) - the front desk staff was very helpful and understanding. Although I was out of sorts and without luggage (i.e. - all of my travel stuff) the stay was very comfortable. I was able to score free toothpaste, soap, shampoo, ect. There is an area to buy snacks and there is also a full service restaurant and bar. Even with the short staffed situation during the ice storm I was able to quickly order and receive a meal via room service. The bed was very comfortable, there was a nice view of the downtown skyline and the hotel has a historic atmosphere. I was very pleased, especially considering the unexpected circumstances. The hotel is very close to the circle downtown and major attractions. No problems at all, great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Indy!”
Reviews.Author: miss_bea_heyvin
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in downtown Indy. The queen suites are huge and quite a value for the space and location. Hotel is just off the circle and within walking distance to a variety of attractions and restaurants. I've stayed there twice and haven't been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, kids enjoyed the pool”
Reviews.Author: bluto_74
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean rooms and bathroom. We ended up here after being turned away from 2 other hotels. Quiet comfortable hotel conveniently located. Only downfall was no on-site parking but reasonably priced lot 1/2 a block away. Breakfast was good in the morning and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: deezee57
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. staff is friendly and rooms are supremely CLEAN. housekeeping staff is right on this one. close to all attractions and a reasonable price the night we went. absolutely loved it. giant bathroom. water pressure in my room (903) was a bit sketchy. kept changing from hot to cold. but i wouldn't let that stop me from staying again

Reviews.Title: “Restored building maintains history and provides comfort.”
Reviews.Author: rysgma
Reviews.Content: This historic bank building in the heart of downtown Indianapolis has been thoughtfully restored with the character being preserved in the lobby staircases, visible mail chutes and room configurations. The room I stayed in was comfortable with a seating area, sleep number bed, flat screen television and wet bar including refrigerator. The catering staff was courteous and attentive and the food well presented. The restaurant is small but eager to accomodate groups and provide daily buffets as well as the option to order from the menu. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Except for the fake palms, the lobby was an inviting space with several seating configurations and a fireplace. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room - great location!"”
Reviews.Author: leighe77
Reviews.Content: We took our preschoolers for a weekend in Indianapolis to see the Children's Museum (amazing, by the way) and Toy Story 3 on Ice at Conseco Fieldhouse (also wonderful). I chose the Hilton Garden Inn because of the location, the indoor pool and because I love old buidlings. The hotel itself used to be a bank and an office building. I thought the lobby was very pretty - but a triffle austere, maybe. That could also be because we felt like we were the only people in the hotel - we saw maybe 10 other guests the entire trip! Service was very good. We checked in with no problem at all and were given a room on the 12th floor. We had reserved a suite so that we could put the girls to bed and stay up to watch TV or maybe have a cocktail. The girls were so impressed with the room. They are currently obsessed with Eloise and quickly dubbed the hotel, "The Plaza." Now I wouldn't call it the Plaza, but the room was immaculate and the beds and bedding were very comfortable. The bathroom was very roomy and we had great views of the city from all over the suite. We had the breakfast buffet in the lobby restaurant the next morning. The selections were pretty standard, but everything was very good. My husband had a made-to-order omlett that he really enjoyed and the girls had waffles and fruit. The price was very reasonable ($28, I believe, for 2 adults and one child - the other is under 3) Again, the service was wonderful. We only had time to use the pool once after checking in on Friday evening but it was beautiful and perfect for my preschoolers to splash around in. We didn't get to try out the hot tub, but I would have loved to be able to do so. We would definitely stay in this hotel again!!! The whole experience was just lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms and bedding need updating!!!”
Reviews.Author: mich196840
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old but nice. Nothing special. My bedding had holes in the sheets and they appeared to be very worn out and stained. i expect more than this from a hilton. THey had a card to buy Hilton Bedding from the Corporate office. Perhaps they should take some advice and buy new for rooms. The edges of the carpeting and in the corners need some serious TLC. Being old shouldnt mean being dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Secondhand smoke infiltrates our stay!”
Reviews.Author: u2nut
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many Hilton Garden Inns and have enjoyed every one but this hotel was completely different. It is an older building that has been converted to a hotel and upon check in, we were completely happy with the suite that we had overlooking Downtown Indy. We left to go to dinner and a musical and when we came back, we were immediately hit with an overwhelming smoke smell in both rooms of the suite. It seemed stronger in the living room so we had to close the door to the bedroom and were unable to use it while our kids slept, which was the whole point of getting a suite. I called the front desk finally and was told that the floor below ours is a smoking floor and the smoke was coming up through the ventilation system. No room changes were offered, just an explanation. The next morning, my husband called the front desk and after talking to several people, we were only given a $50 deduction off the price of the suite. Instead of staying and swimming and working out, we packed up our things and left as quickly as we could. We were very disappointed with the hotel, the appeasement of management and the visit as a whole. As much as we are in Indy, we will never stay at this hotel again. As a pediatrician, my husband knows the risks of secondhand smoke and as a parent of a child with environmental allergies, we are well aware of the dangers that we slept in that night. I would not have put the smoking floors below the non smoking floors! Bad planning. On top of that, the breakfast buffet was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Garden Inn was worth the price”
Reviews.Author: dbp05ret
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn (downtown) the evening of Jan 1, 2011 prior to watching the Indianapolis Colts. We normally stay at the Hampton Inn (downtown) but the Hilton Garden Inn was much cheaper. I was very impressed by the service, complimentary breakfast (honor members) and the pleasant attitude of the staff. The room was on the 5th floor with a king size bed that was perfect for us. The bathroom was topnotch and was very comparable to the Conrad Hilton in Indianapolis. Overall it was a great stay and we intend to stay there again this coming weekend for the Colt's Playoff Game! Self Park was $9.00 and totally convenient (across the street) and in a covered garage.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: bluebeliever
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel and great service. We had multiple couples in several rooms here. We required extra chairs, and tables for a function, they were very accomodating and pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Downtown”
Reviews.Author: jraestoner
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room! The people at the front desk were incredibly friendly and helpful. I did the valet service, and I don't think I will again. Not that they weren't incredibly nice and efficient, but because there is a parking garage right next to the hotel. The hotel is right on the circle!!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Jkknoonan
Reviews.Content: I spent 9 nights in the Hilton Garden Inn on Market St and can truly say it was a home away from home. Unlike the other two HGI properties i have stayed in, this was not a new construction. The hotel is within the walls of an old bank building. It is a very elegant decor which incorporates many of the elements of the old bank. They have posted photos of the old bank and interesting bits of information about its former life. My room (king bed) was very spacious and the housekeeping staff kept it spotless the entire time. The A/C took some getting used to - the thermostat did not seem to be completely accurate but after the first day i figured out how to adjust it to my liking. The desk staff was plesant and professional. But i have to say that a couple of times their directions to various attractions were inaccurate or out of date. But i felt that they were far and above the calibre of most i have encountered in my travels. Their event coordinator, Lindsey, was endlessly patient and proactive with the organizers of our group's visit and really made us feel like she was concerned about our arrangements and enjoyment. The hotel sits practically on the Circle and is an easy walk to dozens of restaurants of all price and variety. There was never a problem finding somewhere to dine. Within the circle is the "Chocolate Cafe" - candy store and ice cream parlor. Definitely a "must do"! Also, stop at the "Tea Pots & Treasures" store directly across from the hotel for a bit of calm and sanity. Nothing to do with the hotel - but it was very aggrivating to me that the majestic Monument in the center of the Circle was not open after 5:00 at night and actually CLOSED on Mondays and Tuesdays! In the middle of vacation season? Give me a break! Very very very poor planning on the part of the City or whoever regulates that attraction. Still - be sure to take a long time to walk around it and read the various inscriptions. It is truly amazing. Just sorry that i was unable to take the trip to the top and purchase souvineres because of the screwy hours of operation. But back to the Hilton Garden Inn- two thumbs WAY UP for the hotel and the amenities!

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown location”
Reviews.Author: southwestgirl_8
Reviews.Content: Lovely room, quiet, great location just off the Circle. I enjoyed the stark architecture, but my husband felt the hotel lacked personality & would have preferred more greenery for a "Garden Inn". Also, there is another Hilton 3 blocks away on Market, so be sure that you are at the right Hilton before going into the parking garage! Front desk & parking staff friendly & competent. I had no complaints except $22 for parking (valet) seemed high. This is a great location for nightlife & shopping and of course for touring the Soldiers & Sailors Monument in the Circle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: abofreeman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location approximately a half block from monument circle in downtown Indianapolis. The front desk staff was very friendly. You can tell it was formerly a bank because when you walk in it looks exactly like an old bank. The rooms are nice, beds are comfortable and bathrooms are clean and also very nice. The only complaint I have was the central air/heating made loud noises when it kicked on and off. It sounded like a flap was being banged up against the duct. It is pretty startling, but wasn't enough to wake us during the night. Overall it is a great hotel (among many) in downtown Indy. The parking is a bit inconvenient, but its right across the street and only $9/day for self park.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MikeGee1220
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Downtown to attend a Pacers game and it was excellent. It was an especially busy weekend in Indianapolis with the Colts, Pacers and a National Cheerleading convention going on in town. The hotel was within walking distance to all the venues, plus restaurants and bars. The hotel handled everything perfectly. The crowd was mixed from families attending the cheerleading conference to groups of sports fans, never once was the staff out of step and above all never once seem overwhelmed. They were able to cater to all the different groups, so no one ever felt out of place. The staff was friendly, check-in was perfect with all our requests and needs meet, the breakfast was good, there was a pantry area to buy forgotten items and snacks for the rooms, and the indoor pool, although small, was a welcome treat. The hotel was converted from a bank so had a unique charm. There is a nice meeting place in the lobby with fireplace where people and families gathered (they even set-up a TV for all the weekend football games) and a nice bar with a friendly atmosphere. I would highly recommend this place for all…from families to sports fans.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel choice!”
Reviews.Author: Alison78
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several Hilton Garden Inns, and just returned from a stay at the Hilton Garden Inn Indianapolis downtown. It was outstanding....a cut above the "usual" Garden Inn (which I like). The hotel is in a beautiful historic building....a converted bank building. The lobby is pretty, and the conversion of the bank into a hotel was done sympathetically. The rooms are very nice: flat screen TVs, dependable internet, a chair and ottoman in which to unwind, etc. The beds have recently been upgraded---I did not understand them to be sleep number beds, but whatever they were, I slept very soundly both nights of my stay. Good business center, too. Most importantly, the staff were, without exception, pleasant, friendly, and helpful. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average, but Cozy”
Reviews.Author: JKincentralIL
Reviews.Content: Service was very nice at front desk and at breakfast in American Grill. Breakfast buffett was somewhat limited, but food was good. Not an overly busy place, which we liked. Said they upgraded to sleep number beds, but not sure the bed was working correctly - a bit hard at first, but not overly so. Location is nice, right off the circle, close to restaurants, circle centre and etc. Overall, we were satisfied with the quite, cozy feel of the place.

Reviews.Title: “What A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: grainbowjudy
Reviews.Content: Never having been to downtown Indianapolis, we were wonderfully surprised by both the hotel and the city. The hotel staff was polite and helpful. The room was spacious and clean. The atmosphere of the lobby was classy yet comfortable. The business center with computer was easily assessible. We stayed the evening of July 4th and due to the rain on the 4th and no fireworks, we stayed another night. We had a great special rate of $99.00 per night and even with the $22.00 valet parking, it was the cheapest rate in town. Due to the wonderful things to do in the city and the safe atmosphere, we walked for about six hours, around the canal and to the zoo and back, and didn't even take our car out of the garage. I would certainly stay there again and look forward to another stay in downtown Indy, as there were still things we did not see.

Reviews.Title: “Staff with a bad attitude”
Reviews.Author: Loutraveler2
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are not concerned with customer service or satisfaction. We booked a specific type of room, but received another type altogether. After three rooms and actually having to argue with the staff, we were placed in a room a little closer to what we booked, but still it was not what we booked. Since they were not able to get us a room with the amount of beds we needed, they sent us a roll out bed, but only after we requested it. The staff member who brought it in the room was rude, he did not assist in setting it up, he just wheeled it in and left without a word. The rooms were clean but that is all that recommends this hotel. The food in the restaurant was only just ok, I certainly wouldn't eat there again. We felt rushed through our breakfast, since the waitress kept trying to clear our things away. Terrible parking. Do not stay at this hotel if you value customer service and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “HGI Indianapolis = good value for a business traveler on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: Reston10
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for business. I selected it because of the price point and location. Upon arrival, I couldn't figure out where to park. I finally found a parking garage behind the building. I later found that this was the hotel's garage (until 06/01/09). I had to go up to the fifth floor, despite the garage being empty, because all of the spaces were reserved. I found an entrance to the hotel on the 3rd floor, but it was locked. I had to go outside and walk around the garage with my bags -- it was pouring rain. The front desk was efficient and had me set-up for zip check-in. I was on the 11th floor. There were several elevators, so it was easy to navigate. The room had a king bed, a working desk and comfortable working chair, and small upholstered chair with ottoman, a hutch with a microwave and fridge, and a desser with a 42" flat screen television. The bathroom was a typical set-up with a sink, toilet, and tub/shower combo. My biggest complaint was the loud, AC unit. The choices appeared to be "off" or "on" -- no automatic. It was hot, so I ended up having to let it run all night...although the noise was bothersome. The carpets and bathroom were clean; and the furniture was in good shape. There were several lamps, and the light was sufficient. There was free (but slow) wi-fi access; and pay wired broadband access. The property appears to have a pool and fitness center, but I didn't use either. For a buisness traveler on a budget, who needs a clean room with a comfortable place to work, in the Monument Circle business district, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Staff with attitude in this interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kaychan
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in May in this hotel. The location of the hotel is good, within walkinng distance to a shopping mall, restaurants and cafes. We did not drive so parking was not an issue. The room was nice and the mattresses were very comfortable. There was coffee/tea available in the lift lobby from morning until they run out. The staff manning the reception were pleasant but not all of them seemed particularly interested in serving the guests. On two occasions, when I approached the counter to ask for information and directions from the staff , only one of them responded with a smile.The other lady just stood there and stared at me and went back to whatever she was doing. She seemed so disinterested and gave me the impression that "I was such a bother". They seemed to forget that we were visitors and had absolutely no idea about the place at all. We had a buffet breakfast at the ground floor restaurant and the food was quite alright, though not particularly fantastic. I had the hot dishes, then the breads and finally the fruits. Even before I finished eating the fruits, the waitress came over to clear away our cutlery and plates and even started to wipe the table. It was still an hour away before they close for breakfast. One has to eat fast in this restaurant . On stepping out from the hotel after our breakfast, we saw a valet attendant brushing his teeth outside the hotel entrance and spitting into the drain after rinsing. He grinned amd apologised when he saw me smiling at him ....but actually I was reeling from shock...could this be happening in a major city in the USA . He then went back to his rinsing and spitting. That was surprisingly bad hygiene in view of the spread of the H1N1 virus, not to say bad manners to do so in public. Why couldn't he use the restroom just located off the lobby of the hotel? The hotel was nice enough to give us a late checkout as our transport to another city would only arrive at 5 pm. However, despite the reception saying they would inform housekeeping, the housekeeping staff came knocking twice on our door to ask when we would leave. We would say that the staff although not overly "professional nor service-oriented" , were pleasant enough to us not to harbour any ill-feelings toward them. They gave us the impression that they had chores to do and must do so on time no matter what....guests or no guests! One of the more interesting hotel I ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...but room had nightmare of a view”
Reviews.Author: extratowels987
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have never been to Indy and were looking forward to our time there for a wedding. The hotel is in a great location...walking distance to several great restaurants, night spots, and a mall. Starbucks and a fabulous little pizza parlor across the street. We had a nice King room with a spacious bathroom. I opened up the curtains to check out our view and was very disappointed. We were on the 5th floor and could catch a hint of actual sky...we were facing the air ducts and other buildings. Called for extra towels once but never received them...just a little pet peeve of mine. Also, parking is a pain and very expensive (14/night self-park, 22/night valet).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location & Staff!! Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: KlingerCrazy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned a trip through the Midwest and were just "passing through" Indianapolis on our way to Chicago, Milwaukee and Greenbay. We liked this hotel so much that we altered our return itinerary to skip St. Louis and go back to Indianapolis. Originally we both thought Indy was a sleeper and were more excited to hit the other cities on our list. Milwaukee and Greenbay were great, Chicago was a bit disappointing but Indianapolis was AWESOME! This hotel and its staff took us under their wing and treated us like we were the most important guests they had - both stays! Their Suite rooms are spacious and well worth the little extra money. The reservation staff (Sarah Nogurera) was extremely helpful and took care of our every need. The desk staff was "human" and gave you the tops in service, no matter how busy. The beds in the suites were air adjustable - so you could have as firm or soft t a bed as you wished. The only oddity was the parking for the hotel was in an adjacent parking garage (discounted rate with room stay) and the garage entrance to the hotel was difficult to navigate with luggage. The Hilton Garden is centrally located right where you want to be in Indy! We can’t wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “good location, parking sucks”
Reviews.Author: CreoleBarbie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days of business travel, conference hotel was the Westin which was a brisk walk (got in more sightseeing that way). Staff was friendly from the day I called to pay for reservation (even got a "stop by to say Hi when you check in"). Comfy bed (I had a handicap accessible room as it was the only one available - I checked in around 2 am). Parking was horrible, limited spaces available in the garage; not accommodating for luggage, etc. Tons of restaurants and shopping are within walking distance. Found 3 Cajun restaurants downtown and an Au Bon Pain for jalapeno/cheddar bagels!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not very user-friendly”
Reviews.Author: halltab
Reviews.Content: Almost every hotel has some kind of access driveway so that people can check in--not this one! After you find a way to check in, you will then have to drive around the block to find the parking lot, which is just not that easy to find. A little bit of helpful explanation from the desk staff would have made this much easier! This hotel doesn't have a really good restaurant, but it's very convenient to many, so this is not a problem. It has a little grill-type restaurant which offers very limited breakfast options. My husband and I went to the breakfast grill early on a week day morning. We were the only people there. I saw the breakfast buffet, and asked the host if it was okay to order breakfast rather than use the buffet. He seemed to think this was a bizarre question. He immediately reeled off a long speech about how many items, what prices, etc, but never really answered my question. When he was finished, I said, so, uh, does that mean I can order something? He said, I think I just explained that to you. I apologized, saying it was still early in the morning, and he did finally say, yes, I could order something. When he took our order, he actually rolled his eyes--he asked me what type of toast (white, whole wheat, etc) and I asked what was their best bread. But many restaurants have some artisan breads they are proud of, and I was just asking if they might have something like that. I really do not think a waiter has ever rolled his eyes at something I've asked. I am not a rude or demanding person; I have a medical reason for avoiding open buffets. I'm just not used to being treated rudely. Needless to say, the next morning we did not go there! We enjoyed a lovely breakfast at the nearby Paradise Bakery, where all the staff people were friendly, cheerful, and helpful. Overall, every time I asked anything at the front desk, I got a response that was just not friendly. Nobody was rude (except the grill host), but I never got the sense that the staff was very concerned or interested. And they were definitely not cheerful or friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the middle of it all..”
Reviews.Author: Boo1
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel. It is located in an old bank building and very impressive. The rooms have large ceilings and have microwave/fridges in them. Of course, this is usual Hilton standards...nice beds and large TV's. Tons of cafes, shops, etc are located within a 5 minute walk. I would recommend to anyone on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Suite! Wonderful Staff! Most Comfortable Bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: SunCker
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 nights stay at this hotel. My husband and I were down to Indianapolis for a business trip. The exterior of the building was beautiful. It is a historic building built in 1914. Originally was named the Fletcher Trust Building and housed a bank. The interior when you 1st walk in is beautifully set up. Very business like but it made you feel comfortable. Lots of comfortable seating in the lobby. The front desk staff were absolutely wonderful. They always knew who you were and asked how your day was. They would help you find places for dinner, dancing, shopping, etc. Very helpful staff. We especially liked Megan! She was so much fun we looked forward to seeing her each day! There is a small restaurant/bar just off the lobby. We had the buffet breakfast and it was so good! The drinks in the evening were tastey as well. Beside the front desk they have a 'pantry' open 24hrs a day where you can buy drinks, water, alcohol, pain killers, chips, gum, chocolate bars, nylons, toothpast, the paper, etc. *You get the picture!* Our room! The suite on the 15th floor! AMAZING. Large Bedroom with sitting area, flat screen TV, mirrored closet, 4 huge windows, large work station, AND the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on in a hotel. The bathroom was just off the bedroom. Very large with a separate toilet area with a door. Big mirror, hair dryer, marble tub surround. The front entrance sitting area had 2 chairs, pull out couch, flat screen tv, work station, fridge, coffee maker, lots of cupboards for storing food etc. Even a microwave! The maid service was excellent as the room was always clean. Location: We really liked the location because it was just a few steps away from the large War Memorial Tower. You can walk or take an elevator to the top and look out over the area! Plus there is a museum inside. Circle Centre Mall was well within walking distance. Really good mall. We loved the Brookstone and Victoria Secret stores! If you go to the Brookstone store, ask for Matt! He's an excellent salesman! Food: We ate at Mo's. Very dressy restaurant that has the best steak in town. Wonderful waiters, especially Sid! There was a person playing piano while we ate and an area to smoke cigars and cigarettes. We ate at Buca's. Italian restaurant. Excellent food and service! **The best place was 'STEAK AND SHAKE'. We don't have them in Canada and we loved it. They sell 'steak burgers' and amazing 'milkshakes'. I'm still craving it. Nightlife: Within walking distance you could go see a football game at Lucas Oil Stadium! We spent each night dancing at Ike and Joneseys! Great bar/club for 30 and up crowd. Overall our stay at this hotel was EXCELLENT. We would love to come back and would recommend it to everyone! PS-There was a pool and workout room but we didn't even get a chance to see it!

Reviews.Title: “Will make it a destination”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLobsters
Reviews.Content: After reading tripadvisor reviews, I booked a room for 11 nights and couldn't have been more delighted. The location is fabulous, and the hotel is a converted bank with large, quiet rooms and lots of charm and the microwave and fridge (in the room) came in very handy .To add to the allure, Kurt Vonnegut's grandfather has an affiliation with the building which unexpectedly blossomed into a quest for all things Vonnegut while I was in the city. It was my first stay in Indy and I was there on business but I plan to make this hotel a vacation destination as the city is vibrant with lots to do - and it's all within walking distance of the Garden Inn. If you go, don't miss the revolving restaurant at the top of the Hyatt which is a great way to get your bearings and enjoy some delicious crab cakes. The Garden Inn is truly a gem and I'm so happy for Tripadvisor where the research was done for me!

Reviews.Title: “Treated us like family!”
Reviews.Author: IndianaDaisy
Reviews.Content: My children and I just returned from a fabulous stay in this next to the circle monument hotel! The kids were able to walk to the capital building, climb the stairs in the circle monument, swim in the pool (no others were there so they enjoyed the pool to themselves!) and have a lovely breakfast. When I called I asked about a kids museum and Zoo package. This hotel offered a buffet breakfast and a zoo package. My kids enjoyed the conversations with the staff (they had been scouts as my kids are now) and one friendly employee kept calling my kids his scouts. They loved it! The coffee by the elevators was much appreciated, the towels by the pool were plentiful, the room was very clean and cozy and the employees were so friendly. They must really enjoy their jobs. We had valet parking and the attendants were quick with retrieving the van and so very nice. thanks for making our stay so pleasant. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Location for Conseco Fieldhouse”
Reviews.Author: Accounting Professor
Reviews.Content: We set off from Lousiville to Indy on a rainy and then snowy Saturday (December 15) to attend a college basketball game. Access from I-65 north was easy off the Marekt Street exit. Our room was ready at 12:30 p.m. We were on the top floor in a large corner room. I would guess that the corner rooms are the largest in the hotel. With two large sets of windows, we had plenty of natural light. Sadly, the color scheme was an "icky" gold with heavy curtains at the windows. The bedding was very comfortable on our two double beds. TVs are not flat screen and still reside in the out of date "armoire". For us the location was excellent. We were 4 blocks from Conseco and one block from the main shopping street. The breakfast was OK. The cook was able to do simple eggs, pancakes, etc., but was cooking on glorified hot plates. The result was slow service! Personnel were young and very friendly. For a one night stay in Indy, the Hilton Garden Inn is reasonably priced and has a convient location.

Reviews.Title: “Suited us perfect”
Reviews.Author: GKJK
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn for a 2 day getaway. I chose this hotel due to the location and the price and it looked nice-which it is. We took our swimsuits since they had an indoor pool, but we never ventured down to the pool area. The good thing is when you first walk in the hotel you don't see or even smell the pool, which is good. The fitness area was closed due to remodeling so it should be pretty nice now if you're into that. The location was great I thought. We walked to the mall (about 2 blocks or so), and to lots of restaurants so there was no need to get our car out of valet (22/night). Go for the valet if you go, it's only about 5 extra dollars a night than self parking. The hotel had nice shampoo/conditioners (Neutrogena) and the bathrooms were nice (no vent though). The rooms were a little small, but fine for the two of us. The tv is a bit difficult to see from the bed (maybe this was just how our rom was set up), but it wasn't too big of a deal. I have read some complaints about the bed, but I thought it was great. I wasn't too crazy about the feather pillows, but overall it was cozy. The only issue we had was that we had to wait about 10 minutes for the valet to bring the car up since the front desk wasn't answering their phone when we called them to have it brought up. This was the day before Thanksgiving, so they were probably going nuts. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Early morning wake up!!”
Reviews.Author: OhioTrav
Reviews.Content: Stayed during our visited to Indy for the Van Halen concert. Room was nice but had a smoky smell. We found the beds very comfortable however I don't believe they were truly full size..My only complaint was that we had housekeeping knocking at 8:00am!!! I thought we had slept past check out!! Very annoying...We have never had that happen that early in the morning....

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss...”
Reviews.Author: Jakey450
Reviews.Content: I too chose the Hilton Garden Inn because of it's fantastic write-up on Trip Advisor. The room was extremely clean and comfortable and the staff was extremely pleasant. However, the beds were the least comfortable of any Garden Inn that I've had the pleasure of staying in. The breakfast service the next morning was HORRIBLE. Not only were we not seated for over ten minutes, but after placing our orders for two over-easy eggs, we waited over 40 minutes before one order came. Finally, the second order arrived another 20 minutes later. I had also heard complaints from other people about the wait time on omlets which was reaching 40 minutes. So, if you stay here, go elsewhere for breakfast. If you're involved in the HHonors loyalty program and wish to stay in another Hilton family hotel, choose either the Hilton downtown or give the Conrad a look. On a Friday night, the rates are usually similar for a luxury hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lauralei2
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn is recommended for those traveling downtown. I used public transpotation ($1.50) and was pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to get from the airport to downtown with the bus stop being one block away. Excellent location to catch the bus for an excursion to the Museum of Art. The hotel is less than a block away from Monument Circle. Everything relatively within walking distance, or the city has a Red/Blue Circulator for free or 25 cents a ride. The hotel is an established older building (the former Fletcher Savings & Trust) with a beautiful Neoclassic style. The rooms are well appointed with high ceilings and the most comfortable bed and pillows I have ever slept on! The Front Staff is pleasant and accomodating. Delicious cookies in the afternoon, and complimentary bottled water are always provided. Very nice Business Center making necessary web access a snap for those who are not bringing a lap-top along. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LWJ9
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hilton Garden Inn due to it's being the number one ranked hotel in Indianapolis on Tripadvisor. Two other couples stayed there due to my recommendation. Unfortunately we were all disappointed. We were going to stay two nights at the Hilton Garden Inn, however, my wife could not breathe in the room very well the night we stayed. I don't know what the problem was. It may have been a smoker stayed in the room or someone had a cat in there. I will say the room was large and seemed clean. The front desk and door man were very helpful. However, the service and food in the restaurant was some of the worst I have experienced. We moved a couple of blocks west to the Hilton Downtown and were much happier the second night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean w/ Great Service, Bed and Room Size Disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: TravelCR
Reviews.Content: Check-in/Arrival: Arrived around 11:00pm, greeted by valet parking and bellhop. Check-in was fast and easy. We went directly up to our room. Entry to hotel was very nice; it had a beautiful fireplace and plenty of seating in the lobby for guests to relax and gather if in a group. Room: Room was decorated nicely, and the refrigerator and microwave are a great addition to the room for guests staying for multiple nights. Beautiful curtains, though the “room darkening” portion could use some help. Instead of going to the floor, like the curtains, the room darkening portions end at the window sill, allowing light to come in through the top and bottom. With a light outside the window, this did light up the room a bit at night. I am not sure if all rooms are like this. Bathroom: I was very pleased with the bathroom overall. With a granite countertop and granite shower walls, it was very up to date. The soap dish was a cheap plastic, which didn’t seem to go with the rest of the bathroom. Towels are your standard hotel variety. Personally, I prefer the vanity and sink to be separate from the shower in a hotel room (just easier to get ready away from all the steam if someone is taking a shower); but this bathroom was not laid out that way. That said, the bathroom was very clean and provided everything a typical guest would need and expect in a hotel bathroom. Bed: The biggest disappointment was the bed. The mattress pad had a lump line throughout the center. We called front desk and they delivered a replacement that we put on the bed…this fixed the problem. I would assume this was just a random occurrence. With the look of this hotel and the type high quality furnishings, they need to upgrade their bed linens. I would recommend replacing the bedspread with a duvet and/or triple sheeting, especially given the current trends in the hotel industry that seem to focus on bedding. Housekeeping: Fantastic. Everything was clean and up to standards. Location: Perfect location for those looking for downtown accommodations. We were able to walk everywhere; I especially appreciated being so close to a downtown mall to finish up some last minute Christmas shopping. Service: Great service; front desk staff were always very helpful in recommending restaurants and/or providing directions. They even lend you an umbrella when it rains! Overall: The room itself was very small. I assume previous posters with glowing reviews were upgraded to the suites with two double beds and/or corner rooms. Traveling with my spouse, we prefer a king size bed, which meant we had to sacrifice space. I would not want to spend much time in the room other than to sleep. If I was here to work or traveling with a family, it would be too cramped. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a clean room with great service in downtown Indianapolis, provided you are either traveling alone or able to get a room that is larger than the one we stayed in. It was my understanding from this hotel that the king bed rooms are all this size. If that remains the case, we will likely look elsewhere the next time we are in Indianapolis...for the money, I prefer a bigger room with a better bed.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: luvnjoy
Reviews.Content: Indeed it was a nice hotel. There were fresh cookies at check-in counter when i arrived. Nicely remodeled, decor had a warm feeling to it, but rooms were small. Didn't like the placement of the bathroom. It was right next to the bed so one someone goes in the light will definitly shine on you. The bathroom too was small. Overall i enjoyed my stay i guess according to its location you get what you pay for. I associated everything in the city to be small with a bigger price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It, Highly Recommend It”
Reviews.Author: rgaspich
Reviews.Content: My husband has been staying at the Hilton Garden Inn in Indy since September and will be there till January. We both can't say enough about it. They have treated him wonderfully. I have visited a few times and have been treated wonderfully as well. The hotel offers a nice pool, fitness center, close to all the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: yoshi9024
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend in Indianapolis. Hilton gaarden Inn was great. I came with 2 teenage girls and we had a great time! The hotel staff was very helpful about every thing we needed and places that we wanted to go. We felt totally safe staying in downtown and loved seeing the city. Thank you to the staff at the hilton Garden Inn for being so nice and helpp!!! Would stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret!”
Reviews.Author: SJL74
Reviews.Content: BOOKING IT: We only live a couple hours away from Indianapolis so this was a last-minute decision to get away as a family. On-line the rates were over $200 due to an expo in town, but we called the hotel itself and secured a rate of $159., their rack rate. GETTING THERE: The hotel is very close to I-65/70. The hotel itself is well-marked and easy to find. THE HOTEL ITSELF: Outside is made of limestone, Neo-classical period. It is a historical building, the Fletcher Savings and Trust bank constructed it in 1914. In 2002 the Hilton Garden Inn bought and restored the building and opend it in 2003 so everything looks recently remodeled. Inside: the style is sleek and modern, but with the old bones of high ceilings and marble columns. Look up to see the beautiful mouldings. The fireplace would be nice to warm up at in the winter, a nice feature in the lobby! OUR ROOM: We loved having room 1522 and would consider it an upgraded room since it was a corner room and so there was more square footage and an additional huge window ! The color scheme is sage green, soft gold and cream. We had two double beds since we travel with our two small children. The bathroom must be handicap-accessable since the door was extra-wide and grip bars were provided in the shower/tub. Our room had a view of Monument Circle, very pretty with the fountain at the base and lots of flowers next to the fountain. The bathroom counter was granite, as was the wall in the shower/tub. Attention was paid to detail, the window treatments are elegant and also have sheers and room-darkening panels. Also, the towels were folded to fan out and toilet paper folded to a point. BONUS: Our room had a microwave and small refrigerator with cabinets to store any food items you brought! So, go ahead and pack that microwave popcorn or if you get in late they sell microwavable meals downstairs! STAFF: EXCEPTIONAL!! The nicest, most helpful people! We are used to working with polite staff, but the group here welcomes in a warm, genuine way and we were asked several times if there was anything we needed. POOL: The reality is better than the internet photos. In reality wall-sconces give up-lighting which is flattering as opposed to the internet photo which looks like it would be florescent lighting. The pool was empty every time except once, we visited five times. There are no slides or diving boards, so bring your own pool toys if you have kids. The pool goes from 3-5 feet and jacuzzi looks like it could fit 8-10 people. A nice feature is that the fitness center looks out to the pool. This is good because: 1) Parents can work out while older kids swim. 2) The fitness center is small and having a wall of glass makes it seem bigger. The fitness center had a bike, stair stepper, weights, treadmills, etc. (Don't forget your room key, you'll need it to unlock the pool doors.) The pool is well maintained, it smells of bleach and we saw several maintenance workers come in to check things, turn on pool lights, etc. Plenty of towels are provided and even a bin to leave used towels. The women's bathroom (I didn't venture in to check out the mens, sorry!) is one big room with plenty of space. A hair dryer is provided and tissues. In one corner is a shower scrubbed to the point that it looks like no one has ever used it. The shower curtain looks new. It could be convenient to swim or workout, then take your shower & get ready right there. EXTRAS: Next to the pool is a coin-operated laundry room in case you like to do laundry during your stay. (We don't, so we are assuming that the machines work properly.) In case you forgot the soap, they sell forgotton items and snacks, etc. at "Pantry Pavillion" next to the front desk. We did use the business center once. It is well-lit and organized. We had no problems using the Internet in our room and printing off our documents in the business center. Room service is available, I would strongly recommend dining outside the hotel. We are big fans of PF Changs, Starbucks is across the street, there is even a micro-brewery nearby, "Rock Bottom". My husband had a business meeting at the hotel's "Great American Grill" and noted that the staff were doing their best, but the food itself was not "great". Eat elsewhere. We walked to the Circle Center Mall. I would not want to walk there in high heels or in freezing/rainy weather, but in July it was a lovely walk. Bring comfortable shoes. We also recommend the nearby Children's Museum. OVERALL: I would say this is a 4-star hotel for families, business travelers, disabled, and singles! If they wanted to move up to 5-star, I would recommend a jacuzzi tub in the bathroom, a cd player, some bathrobes, up-graded bedding (the bedding if comfortable and brand new, but it isn't like sleeping on a cloud such as the Westin's heavenly beds.) and better hotel food service. I would highly recommend this hotel, we have stayed in many hotels in Indy and this is the best 4-star we have found! Uh-oh! The secret is out!! TRAVEL TIP: Request the corner rooms!

Reviews.Title: “A solid choice for downtwon Indy”
Reviews.Author: DaveinAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I chose the Hilton Garden Inn near Monument Circle for our stay based on the excellent TripAdvisor reviews that it gets. I want to add one more...and I'll try not to repeat what is already posted. The good to great: Nice rooms with high ceillings, spotlessly clean, friendly staff, not a "cookie-cutter" hotel (it is a renovated bank building that was unused for 10 years.) All amenities worked, comfortable bed with good pillow choices, lots of storage. Excellent location in a marvellous convention city - I lived in Indy 25 years ago, and they've redone downtown twice since then...great job! Good coffee in lobby all day long. The less than good: Some long waits for elevators. (It seems that there is no "freight" elevator. The staff uses the guest elevators, but I don't think they are allowed to board when guests are on. The result is that they call for the elevator, it stops on their floor, they see you on it, and they wait for the next one.) But that means your elevator can stop 2 or 3 times on the way down. AC system has two choices - fan continously ON (and it is loud) or no AC at all. There are a TON of hotels in downtown Indy. This is an excellent choice, and I now understand why it is so highly regarded.

Reviews.Title: “Great Serice”
Reviews.Author: travellinghopefully
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to give this hotel 5 stars-everyone was so nice-but there were some missing elements. First, the good. Nice big room, beautiful bathroom, reasonably comfy beds and again, I can't say enough about how lovely everyone was! But-they need to do something about the linens. The sheets werent too bad but they had those horrible synthetic blankets and bedspreads-they need to replace them with duvets, and it would be nice to have some bathrobes.Don't bother with breakfast, the buffet was terrible. Other than that, lovely stay with wonderful people.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jsm123456
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the hotel for a meeting nearby. Starbucks right across the street, nice breakfast buffet in the hotel lobby, and two blocks from the Circle Center Mall. Spacious rooms with free wireless internet access. Will return with family for a weekend outing!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place!!”
Reviews.Author: IUBBFAN
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, we stayed here for 2 days in November. Had a great time, really nice hotel. But the valet can sometimes take up to 20 minutes to get your car, I would recommend finding your own parking, they havge one across the street for self parking. Overall a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, fabulous service!”
Reviews.Author: bcdk34
Reviews.Content: My two children and I went to Indy to see the LOTR exhibit at the State Museum and decided at the last minute to stay downtown. I did not have a reservation, but I did have some Hilton Honors points to spend, so we called the Hilton 800 number. They put us in the Hilton Garden Inn and it was beautiful. Expected to be put in the usual "freebie" room somewhere near the boiler room, but they gave us a spacious corner room with windows on two sides and a view of Monument Circle. It was a cold and rainy night, so we didn't venture out, but a call to the desk got us the name and menu for a great little pizza place (affordable, too) across the street that delivered our dinner. Being alone with two kids and not wanting to leave them alone in the room, I must have called the front desk six times for various things and they never once lost patience with me or acted like I was nuts. The only down side was the ventilation fan that blew loudly all night unless you turned the heat off and then it got too cold, which made it difficult to sleep. Well, and the internet access was down. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, Moderately Priced”
Reviews.Author: Zumbido
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night (Dec. 28). Hotel very clean, recently remodeled. Latest business conveniences, such as wired Internet access in our room, and a business center with two computers, a fax machine, and a color laser printer. Staff was friendly, valet parking available at extra cost. Quiet -- no noise from other guests. Good downtown location, less than one block from Monument Circle. Also convenient to Eiteljorg museum and Indiana State Museum. Paid $94.00 plus taxes for a non-smoking king with small refrigerator and microwave. Would return if we wanted to stay downtown again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Thanksgiving night. Granted, the hotel was probably not even half full, so we got great service. The guy at the front desk upgraded our two rooms to end rooms. These rooms were HUGE!!! They were basically two rooms combined. They had two tv's, a couch, large desk. It was awesome. The rooms were decorated very nice and the beds were actually comfortable. This is a must stay if going downtown. Only negative was the price for parking $18, which is standard anywhere downtown.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at he Hilton Garden Inn, in dowtown Indianapolis.. It was located in a great area. Very convienant for the wedding we were attending, the staff was great, the food was good, and the staff was very accomodating.. The room was great, had a refrigerator, microwave, and coffee pot.. The room was large and very quiet. Would definetely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Ditto What they said!”
Reviews.Author: Listenup
Reviews.Content: Thanks to other travelers who gave full marks to this property- It is indeed a great place to stay. The staff here has NOT forgotton they are in the hospitaltiy business. 4 guys in town for a convention, we took two rooms and all was in order. Easy walk to convention center, breakfast was very convenient, free coffee in the lobby, prompt advisement of faxes received, just a real nice property that has their staff well trained, professional and human! Extra effort by Jim the bartender in divining our dining needs and (Ryan,Bryan?) in making reservations for us. Mo's Steakhouse very good, Mikado pretty good, Shula's way too expensive. Self parking $12, with in/out privilages. Many other hotels that charge far north of $ 139/night could take a lesson from this group.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! Huge room! Great location! Friendly staff! Great price (we had a shopping package deal.) LOVED IT!!!!!!! Will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for combining business with pleasure”
Reviews.Author: MuncieMom
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Downtown on several occasions, mostly for business. I have always been impressed with the hotel desk staff, housekeeping, bellman, and valet's friendliness and professionalism- from the moment you pull up to the curb. My most recent stay I was upgraded to a suite because of my HHonors Member status, which was quite a treat. This Hilton Garden seems to be the only Hilton Garden Inn that takes its HHonors members serious with upgrades and free breakfasts, etc. Much appreciated for one who travels a lot for work. The perks are always appreciated. On this visit the GenX Gamers Convention (45,000 people) in Indianapolis had just concluded and the hotel seemed a bit worn and untidy in the halls and elevator. I also noted that at 5:30 AM the coffee was not ready in the lobby on Monday morning for those wanting an early morning cup of joe while reading their USA Today papers. Those would be my suggested improvement comments, but all in all it was-as always a pleasant stay. Hope you keep up with keeping your #1 rating on Tripadvisor.com because Hilton Garden Inn Downtown is a wondeful place for both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in April while attending a convention. The hotel is very nice with a beautify lobby. Rooms are small yet well appointed. Rooms and bathrooms were very clean and came complete with a refridgerator and coffee. Room service was very prompt with good food and reasonable prices. Valet parking is expensive ($19) but they have a self park just around the corner in the Bank One parking garage that is $12 a day with in and out privileges. Room rate is fairly high but is well worth the location and quality of the property. May be able to get discounted rates but since we were attending during a large convention, all hotels were at peak rates. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel...great rooms, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: WindowSeatPlease
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn in Indianaoplis is a fabulous hotel. I stayed based on recommendations on this site and was not disappointed at all. For starters, the location is convenient and overlooks a beautiful monument/circle that you can see from several of the rooms. It feels like it's right in the center downtown and it's an easy walk to a bunch of great food places, a nice mall and several of the sports venues are right nearby. I was in town for business and, from the second I walked in, was greeted by pleasant, friendly staff. My original room was right outside of the elevator area and I wasn't crazy about all that foot traffic. So I went back downstairs and a member of the desk staff immediately offered to help me and, upon hearing my concern, reassigned me to an awesome corner room that directly overlooked the Soldier's monument - no problems. The rooms are a great size and you don't feel like you're walking in a circle - they have beautiful high ceilings as well. The bathrooms are also much bigger than the closets you find in some hotels. Both the room and bathroom were incredibly clean and well-situated - better than any other hotel I've been in. The beds are comfortable and the rooms come with complimentary high-speed internet. The housekeeping staff is through and accomodating of special requests (i.e. I left a note on the bed that I didn't need the underblanket and it was neatly folded on the unused bed for the rest of my stay) The restaurant is top-notch - I had some pasta on my first night and you couldn't have told me I wasn't in an authentic Italian restaurant. The staff are friendly without being pushy and there is generally just a relaxed, cool vibe all throughout the hotel. When you need help, it's there but there isn't a constant "can I help you? can I help you?" that gets annoying. This is just a really cool place and, even as someone who isn't crazy about hotels in general and is very picky, I can't recommend it enough. The environment is comfortable and the staff is wonderful.
